comments.body: Trying right now and will let you know immediately.
It works. Thank you. I will accept the answer in 8 minutes.

answers.body:
Remove the character class around dot. [.]+ matches one or more literal dot characters. But .+ matches any character one or more times.

@"\{text:(?<text>.+),url:(?<url>.+)\}"

DEMO

title: Why the following regular expression does not match the string?
body:
The expression is @"\{text:(?<text>[.]+),url:(?<url>[.]+)\}" and the string is {text:frbs,url:http://koo.gk/xM6J}

I am clueless about where does this go wrong.
